channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VA

item.title: Report X-2024021898
item.description:
Report X-2024021898

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: HAMPTON
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 2/7/2024 at approximately 1930, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 4346935 at the station location in Hampton, reporting an undeclared fuel oil shipment. The package consisted of one glass bottle pacakged inside of a fiberboard box, identical to the package reported in Spill Incident # 3006. Further inspection revealed that the package was identical to the previously reported undeclared shipment. The package is being held for an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2024021756
item.description:
Report X-2024021756

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: WINCHESTER
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking on the conveyor belt manager immediately notified HAZMAT trained employee. Package was isolated and taken to the building's HAZMAT inspection area. DescribePack: Improper packing of the material allowed for damage to occur to the inner containers which were crushed and caused leakage. One of the lids popped off as a result. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: HAZMAT trained employee immediately isolated the package in the HAZMAT inspection area. Package was placed in a HAZMAT bag to reduce further exposure.

item.title: Report X-2024021770
item.description:
Report X-2024021770

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: HAMPTON
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was given to a manager by a package handler, manager then places package in Haz mat bin, and the Haz mat was ten placed under hood vent and the vent was turned on. Package has damage on the side possible by other packages in transit. Contents possibly leaked out due to no seal under cap. DescribePack: Loose caps no seal under cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was given to a manager by a package handler, manager then places package in Haz mat bin, and the Haz mat was ten placed under hood vent and the vent was turned on.

item.title: Report X-2024021394
item.description:
Report X-2024021394

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-12
  • City: WINCHESTER
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered to be leaking due to several cans crushed and one lid popped off. Upon discovery, hazmat-trained employee isolated the package for further inspection. DescribePack: Large dent on side of can caused lid to pop off; paint clips still intact. No inner packing to protect items. (One 1-gallon can, three 1-quart cans.) DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in tied hazardous materials bag to decrease exposure to odor, and taken to hazardous materials cage for inspection.

item.title: Report X-2024021432
item.description:
Report X-2024021432

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: ASHLAND
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A LEAKING PACKING CAME TO QA CAGE 1, THAT APPEAR TO BE LEAKING. IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE TWO BOTTLES HAD LEAKED AND IT WAS PLACED IN THE HAZMAT CAGE FOR DAMAGED HAZMAT PROCESSING. IT SEEMED THE THE PLASTIC CAP CLOSURES BEGAN TO LEAK. DescribePack: IT SEEMED THE THE PLASTIC CAP CLOSURES BEGAN TO LEAK. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE TWO BOTTLES HAD LEAKED AND IT WAS PLACED IN THE HAZMAT CAGE FOR DAMAGED HAZMAT PROCESSING

item.title: Report X-2024021391
item.description:
Report X-2024021391

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-13
  • City: COLONIAL HEIGHTS
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on the trailer by qa and was leaking. Because the hazmat was leaking the team pulled it off the trailer and held the item in a salvage drum to store it until processing. DescribePack: Upon inspection it was found that the cap on the top of the jerrican was loose while in transit causing the hazmat to leak out of the jerrican leading to the outer box being damaged. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: team pulled it off the trailer and held the item in a salvage drum to store it until processing.

item.title: Report X-2024021365
item.description:
Report X-2024021365

  • City: HAMPTON
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered by a package handler wet with an odor. Package was given to management and place under the vented hood in the hazmat cage. DescribePack: Holes in the tops of the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package place under vented hood. hood system turned on
